item.title: Fast Correlation
item.description: There are two methods for computing the correlation of complex-valued signals. The first one is a time-domain method, and for a stationary process can be computed using the following formula $$ r(k) = \begin{cases} \frac{1}{N} \sum^{N-k-1}_{n=0} x(n+k)h^{\ast}(n) & \text{if } 0 \leq k \leq N-1 \\ r^{\ast}(-k) & \text{if } -(N-1) \leq k \lt 0 \\ 0 & \text{if } elsewhere \end{cases} $$ where N is the input data record length, x(n) is the input data and h(n) is the kernel, or reference data.
